descriptions.introToMeditation: The aim of this first exercise is to show you the basic principles and techniques to make your meditations as satisfying as possible.
descriptions.fosterMindfulness: Learn to be present in the moment and develop a greater awareness of your thoughts, feelings, and surroundings.
descriptions.lovingKindness: Cultivate feelings of compassion, love, and empathy for yourself and others through this guided meditation.
descriptions.focusingOnWork: Improve your concentration, productivity, and work efficiency with techniques designed for the workplace.
descriptions.focusingOnStudy: Enhance your learning abilities, memory retention, and study focus with this targeted meditation practice.
descriptions.fiveSenses: Ground yourself and reduce anxiety by connecting deeply with each of your five senses in this mindfulness exercise.
descriptions.positivityBoost: Elevate your mood and develop a more positive outlook on life with this uplifting meditation practice.
descriptions.lettingGo: Learn to release attachments, negative emotions, and thoughts that no longer serve your wellbeing.
descriptions.fallingAsleep: Calm your mind and body to prepare for a restful night's sleep with this relaxing bedtime meditation.
descriptions.soothingSleep: Experience deep relaxation to help you fall into a peaceful and restorative sleep more easily.

personalityTest.title: Personality Test
personalityTest.discoverTitle: Discover Your Personality with a Simple Test!
personalityTest.description: Personality tests reveal your unique traits and strengths. They boost self-awareness, guide career choices, and improve mental well-being. Take the quiz to understand yourself better!
personalityTest.introvertDescription: Thoughtful and reflective, you recharge in solitude.
personalityTest.extrovertDescription: Energetic and outgoing, you thrive on social connections.
personalityTest.ambivertDescription: Equally energized by deep conversations and peaceful solitude.
personalityTest.question: Question
personalityTest.introvertTips: Thriving as an introvert: Embrace your strengths in deep thinking and creativity, find environments that suit you, improve communication, and practice self-care. Step outside your comfort zone gradually to grow and succeed.
personalityTest.extrovertTips: Thriving as an extrovert: Harness your natural communication abilities and social energy. Practice active listening and allow space for others to contribute. Find balance by developing comfort with occasional solitude.
personalityTest.ambivertTips: Thriving as an ambivert: Leverage your adaptability to connect with different types of people. Learn to recognize your energy patterns and honor both your social and solitary needs.

weaknesses.overthinking: The tendency towards overthinking and ruminating

1.question: How do you typically recharge your energy?
options: By being around others and socializing
It depends on the situation and my mood

2.question: How do you typically approach meeting new people?
options: With excitement and a desire to get to know them
With some hesitation or nervousness, but still willing to engage

3.question: What do you prefer to do on a Friday night?
options: Hang out with companions or participate in a social gathering
Stay home and watch a movie or engage in a solitary activity
Reflecting on the week alone and unwinding quietly

4.question: How do you typically recharge after a long day or week?
options: Spending time with friends or attending social events
Engaging in a solitary hobby or activity
Relaxing at home while enjoying a book or movie

5.question: How do you feel about being the centre of attention?
options: Enjoy it and find it energizing
Tolerate it but feel uncomfortable or self-conscious
Dislike it and actively avoid being the centre of attention

6.question: How do you usually handle conflict?
options: Try to find a compromise or mediate

7.question: What type of environment helps you focus best?
options: A little background noise or music

8.question: How do you prefer to make decisions?
options: A balance of both depending on the situation

9.question: When facing a stressful situation, what is your first reaction?
options: Analyze it and plan my response
Seek comfort or talk to someone
Try to distract myself or escape it

10.question: Which best describes how you express your emotions?
options: Rarely, I keep them to myself

11.question: How do you feel about routines?
options: I thrive on structure and consistency
I like some routine but also spontaneity
I prefer to go with the flow

12.question: How do you handle criticism?
options: I take it constructively and reflect on it
I feel hurt but try to improve
I get defensive or avoid it

13.question: What role do you usually take in a group setting?

14.question: What gives you a sense of accomplishment?

15.question: How do you usually approach problem-solving?

16.question: When you're overwhelmed, what do you usually do?
options: Talk to someone or ask for help

17.question: How do you typically show support to others?

19.question: How do you react to unexpected changes?

20.question: How do you prefer to communicate?

21.question: How do you typically deal with failure?
options: Learn from it and move forward

23.question: How do you prepare for a big task?
options: Outline main points and jump in
Start spontaneously and adjust along the way

24.question: How do you usually celebrate your achievements?

25.question: How important is alone time to you?
options: Very important, I need it regularly
Not very important, I prefer being with others

26.question: How do you handle boredom?
options: Relax and wait for it to pass

27.question: How often do you reflect on your thoughts or emotions?
options: Rarely, I focus on the present

28.question: How do you manage your daily schedule?
options: Use some structure but stay flexible
Go with the flow, no strict plan

29.question: What do you prioritize most in relationships?

30.question: What does success mean to you?
options: Making a difference in others' lives

affirmations.1: You are allowed to be exactly who you are.
affirmations.2: Your feelings are valid and deserve to be acknowledged.
affirmations.3: It's okay to prioritize your mental health today.
affirmations.4: You are stronger than the challenges you're facing right now.
affirmations.5: Taking time for yourself is not selfish, it's necessary.
affirmations.6: Small steps forward are still progress worth celebrating.
affirmations.7: You don't have to be perfect to be worthy of love and respect.
affirmations.8: It's okay to ask for help when you need it.
affirmations.9: Your past mistakes don't define your future potential.
affirmations.10: You deserve peace and joy in your life.
affirmations.11: Your presence in this world makes a difference.
affirmations.12: You are enough exactly as you are right now.

games.title: Games
games.failedToLoadProgress: Failed to load your progress. Please try again.
games.failedToSaveProgress: Failed to save your progress. Please try again.
games.levelCompletedMessage: Great job! You can proceed to the next level.
games.cannotConnectMessage: These dots cannot be connected without crossing other paths.
games.connectInstructions: Connect matching colors by dragging from one dot to another.
games.mathInstructions: Fill in the blanks to make the math equations correct.
games.matchingInstructions: Find matching pairs of items by flipping the cards.
games.timeUpMessage: You ran out of time. Try again?
games.selectCellMessage: Please select an empty cell or a ? cell first.
games.mathHint1: Fill in the value that makes 7 + ? = 15 correct.
games.mathHint2: Solve both horizontal equations on the top and bottom rows.
games.mathHint3: Find values that make both horizontal equations work.
games.mathHint4: Fill in the missing numbers to make the equations work both horizontally and vertically.
games.mathHint5: Complete the puzzle by finding values that satisfy multiple equations at once.
games.mathHint6: Challenge: Some of the equations might be misleading!
games.mathHint7: Advanced level: Solve for values that work in multiple rows and columns.
games.mathHint8: This puzzle requires finding numbers that satisfy both rows and columns.
games.mathHint9: Master level: Many equations must be satisfied simultaneously.
games.mathHint10: Expert level: This is the hardest challenge with potential red herrings!
games.mathHintDefault: Solve the math puzzle by finding the correct values.
games.mathInstructionsDetailed: Fill in the blanks to make the math equations correct. Tap to select a cell, then tap a number to place it. Hold a placed number to remove it. Use the undo button to correct mistakes.
games.howToPlayMessage: Find matching pairs of items by flipping the cards. Try to complete the level with the fewest moves and in the shortest time. Watch out for the time limit!

test.title: Test to identify mental health level
test.description: Our Psychodiagnostic Test evaluates stress, anxiety, and emotional well-being using proven psychological methods.

insomniaTest.title: Insomnia Rating
insomniaTest.insight: Evaluate your sleep quality and identify potential sleep disturbances.
insomniaTest.signInMessage: Please sign in to take the test
insomniaTest.saveError: Unable to save your test results. Please try again.
insomniaTest.deleteConfirmation: Are you sure you want to delete this test result?
insomniaTest.deleteError: Unable to delete history. Please try again.
insomniaTest.disclaimer: This assessment is for informational purposes only and should not be considered as a substitute for professional medical advice. If you're experiencing sleep difficulties, please consult a healthcare provider.

questions.sleepTime: How many minutes do you need to fall asleep?
questions.sleepDuration: How many hours do you sleep during the night?
questions.lightSleep: I wake up from the slightest sound.
questions.notSlept: I feel that I have not slept all night.
questions.thinkAboutSleep: I think a lot about my sleep.
questions.afraidToBed: I am afraid to go to bed because of my disturbed sleep.
questions.feelFit: I feel fit during the day.
questions.sleepingPills: I take sleeping pills in order to get to sleep.

feedback.healthy: You have healthy sleep patterns with minimal insomnia symptoms.
feedback.mild: You show mild symptoms of insomnia. Some lifestyle adjustments might help.
feedback.moderate: You show moderate symptoms of insomnia. Consider consulting a professional.
feedback.significant: You show significant insomnia symptoms. Professional help is recommended.
feedback.severe: You show severe insomnia symptoms. Please consult a sleep specialist.

insights.title: Insights
insights.improveRange: could be improved. Try to aim for 7-9 hours of sleep.
insights.goodQuality: Your sleep quality appears to be good. Keep maintaining your healthy sleep habits.
insights.considerRoutine: Consider implementing a consistent bedtime routine and avoiding screens before bed.
insights.benefitHygiene: You might benefit from sleep hygiene improvements and relaxation techniques.
insights.professionalGuidance: Professional guidance could help you develop better sleep patterns.
insights.sleepSpecialist: A sleep specialist can help address your specific sleep challenges.

lifeSatisfactionTest.title: Life Satisfaction
lifeSatisfactionTest.insight: Understand your overall life satisfaction and identify areas for personal growth.
lifeSatisfactionTest.signInMessage: Please sign in to take the test
lifeSatisfactionTest.saveError: Unable to save your test results. Please try again.
lifeSatisfactionTest.deleteConfirmation: Are you sure you want to delete this test result?
lifeSatisfactionTest.deleteError: Unable to delete history. Please try again.
lifeSatisfactionTest.disclaimer: This assessment is designed for informational purposes only and should not be considered as professional advice. Please consult with appropriate professionals for personalized guidance.

questions.closeToIdeal: In most ways my life is close to my ideal.
questions.excellentConditions: The conditions of my life are excellent.
questions.satisfied: I am satisfied with my life.
questions.importantThings: So far I have gotten the important things I want in life.
questions.changeNothing: If I could live my life over, I would change almost nothing.

feedback.extremelyDissatisfied: You appear to be extremely dissatisfied with your current life.
feedback.dissatisfied: You appear to be dissatisfied with your life.
feedback.belowAverage: You appear to be slightly below average in life satisfaction.
feedback.generallySatisfied: You appear to be generally satisfied with your life.
feedback.satisfiedMostAreas: You appear to be satisfied with most areas of your life.
feedback.extremelySatisfied: You appear to be extremely satisfied with your life.

insights.title: Insights
insights.significantImprovement: your responses indicate significant room for improvement in life satisfaction. Consider professional support to explore ways to enhance your well-being.
insights.somePositive: while there are some positive aspects in your life, there might be areas where changes could bring greater satisfaction.
insights.healthyLevel: you show a healthy level of life satisfaction. Consider what specific elements contribute most to your contentment.
insights.strongSatisfaction: you demonstrate strong life satisfaction across multiple areas. Your approach to life appears to be working well.
insights.exceptional: you show exceptional life satisfaction! Your outlook and life choices seem to be creating very positive outcomes.

selfEsteemTest.title: Self-Esteem Scale
selfEsteemTest.insight: Evaluate your self-esteem and discover areas for personal growth and development.
selfEsteemTest.signInMessage: Please sign in to take the test
selfEsteemTest.saveError: Unable to save your test results. Please try again.
selfEsteemTest.deleteConfirmation: Are you sure you want to delete this test result?
selfEsteemTest.deleteError: Unable to delete history. Please try again.
selfEsteemTest.disclaimer: This assessment is for informational purposes only. If you're experiencing persistent concerns about self-esteem, consider consulting with a mental health professional for personalized guidance and support.

questions.satisfiedWithMyself: On the whole, I am satisfied with myself
questions.noGoodAtAll: At times, I think I am no good at all
questions.goodQualities: I feel that I have a number of good qualities
questions.asWellAsOthers: I am able to do things as well as most other people
questions.notProud: I feel I do not have much to be proud of
questions.uselessAtTimes: I certainly feel useless at times
questions.personOfWorth: I feel that I'm a person of worth, at least on an equal plane with others
questions.moreRespect: I wish I could have more respect for myself
questions.feelFailure: All in all, I am inclined to feel that I am a failure
questions.positiveAttitude: I take a positive attitude toward myself

feedback.veryLow: Your self-esteem level appears to be quite low. Consider seeking support to build a more positive self-image.
feedback.belowAverage: Your self-esteem is below average. There's room for improvement in how you view yourself.
feedback.moderate: You have a moderate level of self-esteem. There are both strengths and areas for growth.
feedback.good: You show good self-esteem. Continue building on your positive self-image.
feedback.veryHealthy: You demonstrate very healthy self-esteem. Keep maintaining this positive self-view.

insights.title: Insights
insights.challengesWithPerception: it seems you might be experiencing some challenges with self-perception. Consider working with a counselor to develop strategies for building self-esteem.
insights.recognizeQualities: while you recognize some of your positive qualities, there's room to develop a stronger sense of self-worth.
insights.balancedView: you have a balanced view of yourself, though there might be specific areas where you could build more confidence.
insights.generallyPositive: you maintain a generally positive self-image while being aware of areas for personal growth.
insights.strongSense: you demonstrate a strong sense of self-worth and maintain a healthy balance in self-perception.

worryTest.title: Worry Test
worryTest.insight: Gain a deeper understanding of your mental state with personalized analysis and feedback.
worryTest.signInMessage: Please sign in to take the test
worryTest.saveError: Unable to save your test results. Please try again.
worryTest.deleteConfirmation: Are you sure you want to delete this test result?
worryTest.deleteError: Unable to delete history. Please try again.
worryTest.disclaimer: This report is a tool to empower you to have informed conversations with your doctor or healthcare provider. It is not a diagnosis. Please consult with your healthcare provider if you are concerned about your health.

questions.noTimeWorry: If I don't have enough time to do everything, I don't worry about it.
questions.dontTendWorry: I do not tend to worry about things.
questions.cantHelp: I know I shouldn't worry about things, but I just cannot help it.
questions.underPressure: When I am under pressure I worry a lot.
questions.alwaysWorrying: I am always worrying about something.
questions.easyDismiss: I find it easy to dismiss worrisome thoughts.
questions.finishTask: As soon as I finish one task, I start to worry about everything else I have to do.
questions.nothingMore: When there is nothing more I can do about a concern, I don't worry about it anymore.
questions.worrierAllLife: I've been a worrier all my life.
questions.noticeWorrying: I notice that I have been worrying about things.
questions.cantStop: Once I start worrying, I can't stop.
questions.worryProjects: I worry about projects until they are all done.

feedback.noWorries: No worries! You're handling things very well.
feedback.noticeable: Your concerns are noticeable but not severe.
feedback.moderate: You're experiencing moderate levels of worry.
feedback.high: Your worry levels are high. Consider talking to a professional.
feedback.veryHigh: You're experiencing very high levels of worry. Please consult a mental health professional.

insights.title: Insights
insights.managingWell: you're managing your worries relatively well, though there's room for improvement.
insights.noticeableLevels: you're experiencing noticeable levels of worry that might benefit from attention.
insights.needCoping: your worry levels indicate a need for developing better coping strategies.
insights.significantChallenges: your responses suggest significant challenges with worry management.
insights.focusOn: You might want to focus on managing
